so i wrote about doom , and a part of its legacy that i feel a lot of old-school first-person shooters pass over . <url> <url>

deep in the nuances of the former human ( zdoom decorate ) code recently , i was struck by how long the delay between their " aim " and " fire " frames are , 0.2857 seconds . i realized how much of my playing in hitscanner-heavy areas is about exploiting this window .
what a strangely specific value . i wonder how much tweaking went into it .
it's 10 tics ; tics in doom are 1/35 of a second , an even 2x of 70hz the vsync rate of the vga mode doom used .
